Get so much more for what you pay for. So disappointed!
I love Cpk! Easy place to go get food and chill. Me and my mom were at Rodeo, and wanted some food, so we came here and it was amazing.

came here for my first time and absolutely loved it. service was superb and pizza was very good. came in during lunch time so was a little busy but efficient. tried the fish tacos and pizza Bianca as well as a peach tea!  try to come during non lunch hours if possible. parking is very convenient to my dentist at glamorous smiles so I'll definitely swing by when I can visit again

I downloaded the Yelp app right this second as I'm sitting in the restaurant just so I can leave this review. I've been coming here for years and I can say now that I will NEVER come here again. Two of the staff were extremely rude, one of which seemed to be the manger.  If you want more than six pieces of pasta when you order a pasta, then don't eat here. And if you don't want to get a disgusting, bad attitude from the staff for bringing it to their attention, then don't eat here.

I had a great time at this restaurant- food was excellent (the garlic chicken and vegetables is the best) and staff were super friendly. I will definitely be back. A side note- I left my card at the restaurant and was incredibly relieved to find out they had it and got it back to me safely.

Came here with my club group Thursday night.  The place was PACKED, not only because, well, it was Thursday (a day typically bustling with college night life), but also there happened to be a movie premiere for some new Johnny Depp movie. As expected then, the area was crowded, the streets were blocked, and parking was a nightmare. But I digress. CPK was filled with people, but we had reserved a table for seven. No wait, and the drinks and orders were accomplished relatively quickly. We ordered 4 pizzas (Hawaiian,  Mushroom-Pepperoni, Thai, and BBQ Chicken, I think), two salads (mixed greens with cranberries, walnuts,  and feta cheese and a Chinese chicken-like one. I don't exactly remember), and for me carnitas tacos. The tacos were surprisingly good. The pork had been fried, so it was at once crispy and tender. Had no regrets for adding avocados for an extra 99 cents. As for the rest of the food, I only had the cranberry walnut salad, but I enjoyed the taste of the balsamic vinaigrette and feta cheese, although CPK could have cut down on the amount of dressing. Had a slice of all 4 pizzas; my favorite would have to be the BBQ chicken. I found the Mushroom-Pepperoni too greasy and salty. Maybe it's because I'm not a huge fan of thin-crustedp pizza, but regardless, the pizzas were decent. Despite the crowded night, I had a pleasant, food-filled experience. Definitely come with friends!
Ordered the Five Cheese Pizza. Was not good at all. Too oily. Also ordered the Artichoke dip which could have been better. Would not come here again.

I work closeby so I stopped by for lunch on a weekday with a coworker.  They've done a nice job renovating the inside of the restaurant.  It looks bigger and more open.  They have a nice lunch menu; options such as pizza, soup or salad.  I had their mushroom and spinach pizza with tortilla soup.  The pizza was pretty tasty; good size for lunch portion.  Soup was a nice size as well.  Overall, it was a pleasant visit. Staff and service was friendly and checked in on us regularly.

I've been on hold with CPK for the past 10 minutes only to have them hang up on me, repeat the same information over and over again and are unable to deliver due to me being barely out of their mile radius. Horrible service.

Good service and food at this location. They don't take reservations and the wait can be pretty long during peak hours but that's normal. I haven't been since they've remodeled it so I'm looking forward to checking it out.

I go to this restaurant 1 or 2 times weekly and I love all dishes and desserts there. All people that work their are kind and polite. The environment outside is unique, many students from UCLA are shopping...talking...laughing...  I go there alone , but I feel I'm with a big group of happy people. I will share many picture of foods now. You can have some low calorie dishes too.
Good food like always. Great variety and fast service. Pizza is amazing. You can't go wrong.
Quick effiicient service at the bar, the bartender (Jason?) took great care of me and made me feel welcome. The pizza is the perfect size for one person and was well prepared and piping hot.

They say that the best things in life are free....or those things are BBQ Chicken Pizzas with bacon and avocado added for a little more.  I have always ordered the traditional pie when I come here, but in this particular case they said that they could add avocado and bacon to this creation. So I did....It was good... Next time you have a hankering for CPK's Barbecue chicken pizza, splurge, and allow yourself to be overwhelmed by the new textures avocado and bacon give to a classic pie.  Just do it.
on   for work lunch - terrible. absolutely 100% cold, as was my coworker's. His also had only one of the toppings he'd ordered. bleh, how disappointing

Came here for lunch with coworkers. We left 15 mins prior to noon to avoid the lunch crowd but that didn't help. There were 5 of us and it took forever for our food to arrive. Granted that when we arrived, there were barely anyone there. About 20-30 mins later, we each got our food at the same time. I ordered the Japanese eggplant veggie pizza which was actually pretty good. The pizza is decent sized but still overpriced. Nothing special about this place. It was my first time and most likely my last time i would ever go here unless it was chosen by someone else.  P.S. remember to bring your UCLA medical center badge if you work there! You get 20% off the entire bill.

I'm old enough to remember when this place was just the greatest - a really cool a chic place to go and have barbecue chicken pizza. I feel like it's caught in a time warm now, sort of like a middle-aged man who still dresses the way he did when he was 22 and happy. The food is just not as interesting anymore as it once was (the BBQ chicken salad is downright dull).

I've eaten at a lot of CPKs but this is by far my most favorite.  My friend and I came in here before heading to a concert over at Royce Hall and we had such a good time.  We got a nice roomy booth and we ordered the sundried tomato penne and the artichoke and spinach pizza and both were DELICIOUS.  We topped it off with their new Butter Cake dessert and we were in HEAVEN!!! We got great service from "Tim".  He didn't pressure us to leave right away as we lingered around talking for a little bit as we had time to kill before the concert.  If I was ever in the area I would definitely come here again.

I only ate half my pizza, and they boxed it for me. I get home to only a quarter of a pizza. Jerks! They also sat us in the back at a wobbly table and refused to move us because there weren't any more 2 people tables (there were 4 people tables left). Terrible...even though the pizza was tasty.

This review is solely based on the food since I got take out.   What I ordered:  Crispy Mac n' Cheese:  Fried and covered with cheese, it can't be that bad right? WRONG. Even my bf cringed upon eating these and he has pretty much no standards when it comes to fried foods. For the price you pay, you'd at the very least expect house made mac n' cheese. These might as well have come from a box, cause that's what it tasted like.  Avocado Club Spring Rolls- For something called an AVOCADO spring roll, there was maybe a couple slivers of avocado, at best. Not worth the price. Skin was soggy not crispy. If you're having a hankering for fried avocado rolls, go to BJ's Brewery. They have avocado spring rolls stuffed with avocado for half the price. The rolls here are absolute jokes. Cedar Plank Salmon- Not terrible. Overcooked maybe but tolerable. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine: Pasta and chicken were DRY.  VERDICT? Blech. Most disgusting highly priced food I've had in a long time.

CPK! You are improving. And I had a lovely experience here today. Food was great--super fresh, flavorful, and a large variety. I think their new menu options really bring in many new choices of flavors and combinations..a great way to try new recipes without having to try new places (and risk sacrificing quality of ingrediants). Everything was yummy, well-cooked, and I had a lovely dining experience. The waiters were SO friendly and welcoming, keeping our party good-to-go on refills and checking in on us to make sure that our dining experience was great! My party ordered: -carmelized peach salad w/ salmon (yummy! salmon was very good) -their new mother's day special fresh salad -mushroom pizza
Review based on their new menu item: Quinua and Arugula Salad! VERY delicious! and healthy! Good change to CPK!

Remind me never to eat at a chain restaurant in a college town again.  1. Not CPK's fault, but I don't think I like being served by college students who part time at a restaurant. I guess I'm just used to being served by professionals. 2. I couldn't determine which one it was, or maybe it was both, but either the tables or the menus smelled like old wet rag. 3. Food took for ever to come out. Table finished all our drinks before anyone came back to check on us and only did because we asked what's up with the food. 20 minutes passed after order was taken and drinks were served. Nothing on our table but empty glasses.

This place just doesn't fail to disappoint.  The salad was pretty pitiful (I ordered the California Cobb). CPK calls the nasty white centers of lettuce hearts a salad? With dressing so minimal... I could not have told the difference between what I got and a "100-calorie only!" sized rip-off for lunch.  And the strawberry lemonade - CPK, your competitor down the street at least gives it a full-hearted attempt by adding (or better yet! making it with) REAL strawberry or something that at least is authentic enough to contain strawberry seeds. At CPK, you'll pay for what seems to be high fructose-ey Minute Maid lemonade mixed with some other yucky excuse for the strawberry component. Again, a disappointment.  On the plus side, the service this time was much better. I can for sure confirm that I will not be returning to this CPK again, much less any other. The food here is simply disappointing.

I came here with a group of coworkers for lunch and had a really great experience. We had group of 8 people so the wait took a bit of time before we were seated outside. The waiter was very friendly and service was quick. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine as one of their new adventures items. In my opinion, it had a tad too much zucchini and too little fettuccine. The cook was very generous with the shrimps though and I was very happy since I'm a big fan of them. The sauce was creamy and I like it a lot.  My coworkers ordered various pizza as well as the Chinese Salad and they all seemed to like them a lot. The good thing about CPK is that its menu basically has food from all over the world so you can get a little bit of everything if you share.

Don't get me wrong... the food here isn't too bad.  I really like the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza, and the Waldorf salad.  It's just not too much fun being overrun by all the UCLA students around here with their parents visiting for the week, and having to wait for it.   Parking isn't impossible on the streets... if you're looking for meter spots I think immediately around is $1 an hour, payable by credit car, only until 8pm.  The Broxton garage across the street isn't too bad, and is actually free if you get in before 6:01... for 2 hours.  Otherwise it's a flat $3 for now.   Give it a shot if your parents are in town...

It takes a lot of bad shit to fuck up a CPK experience.  And you know what?  I don't appreciate that at all.  OK.  Sorry, let me calm down. My friend and I came here one Saturday afternoon for some lunch.  First of all, the place kind of smells like Chuck E. Cheese.  Not very appetizing.  We waited about ten minutes for anyone to acknowledge our existence. And the waitress that did finally talk to us was very awkward and made us both very uncomfortable.  Don't get me wrong - I love a good awkward person.  But this girl was so awkward that she was sort of condescending.  It was bizarre. We order all our food and just sat there.  And sat there.  And sat some more. Until finally the waitress brings out some stuff we didn't order and says, "Oh this is on the house!"  Like we're supposed to be grateful that any kind of food found its way to our table.   So we don't eat any of it because a) it's not what we ordered; and b) we actually want OUR FUCKING FOOD.   Everything finally comes out and it looks like it's been siting around for a while.  You know how salad dressing starts to bead up when it's been left out too long?  That's what was happening to both our meals.  My friend is so over the whole experience and she decided to get her salad boxed up without taking a bite.  I eat about half my salad and decide that if the salad isn't doing too well right now, it's probably not a good idea to box it up.  More time won't help that shit. And this is where shit got ugly.  I tell the waitress that I'm all done and she goes, "Oh you didn't like it?"  Are you fucking kidding me?  Just because some pathetic salad is sitting in front of me, I'm supposed to eat the whole thing?  What if I was full from all the other shit you tried to feed me with?  Or if I had an eating disorder?   Even if I truly didn't like, you don't ask something like that, because then you're putting someone on the defense by trying to make them explain themselves.  It was just so shitty all around.  And it's making me question my love affair with CPK... not cool.

Take out order was promised in 10 minutes, available in 45.  Extremely rude service.  When I arrived after 15 minutes, the takeout guy said it was still in the oven, then I heard nothing.  After 35 minutes, I asked the 3 waitresses at reception how long a take out order should take.  They all said 10 minutes, so I asked where my order was.  One looked and found that it had been in a warming oven.  Of course in the 10 minutes it took me to get home, it was stone cold.   As I left I called out to the guy that they should be honest with customers.  He said I was being rude.  I said it was rude of them to take 45 minutes for something they promised in 10 minutes.  He shouted that the time was nowhere close to this.  According to my watch, it was 45 minutes.  How do these people stay in business gratuitously insulting customers?

I went here and sat inside once with a friend. The service was very good. The server continually came to ensure that we were alright, and made sure our cups were always full. I always get the Garlic Fettuccine and it always is fantastic. Since the one visit, I have gone back and ordered my Fettuccine take out. Overall, the takeout service is great. I have never had to wait longer than 10 minutes because I normally order my food before I arrive. Overall, great place with good food. Great to go to have lunch or dinner with a friend.
Good tasting topping, nice dough. I was at the head of the line for the takeaway, and the service was fast, but I was still begin many online orders, it seems. So, I will be going online next time.

Awesome new bar at California  Pizza Kitchen with the freshest ingredients I've ever seen. Pizza ((Roasted artichoke  and spinach stop chicken) was honestly amazing. The two bartenders (Dan and Ryan) were the nicest, friendliest guys I've seen bartend in ages. So nice to one another, the staff and customers.    Go there,  enjoy, you won't be sorry!

Salutations santa's little yelpers!! I just ate here on my lunch break, it was virtually empty yet took 40 minutes for my chicken sandwich, which leads me to believe the chef kept tripping on the abundance of pygmy warriors they use to hunt the chickens, they hate their job, or they just trying to keep the white man down... the sandwich was the bomb though, or if I was in an airplane, "it was really good"... Thanks Annie  I'll give ya a half salute because the pygmy warriors may actually exist in the kitchen

The food was pretty good, its just that service was excruciatingly slow. We were sitted really quickly probably due to some mistake - there was a wait list but the hostess sat us down anyway after looking around the restaurant. Star for that. We sat around waiting... waiting... the waiter finally came and we just ordered everything at once because they were taking a long time to get to us. I ordered bbq chicken pizza, the works, fresh green salad and the tri colour salad pizza. I liked the works - tasted like pizzas I ate in Korea before. Tri colour salad pizza is basically a salad on top of thin pizza crackers - it was REALLY chewy, oddly so. Maybe they over cooked it?? The salad never came - we didn't really ask about it because the salad pizza was pretty much like a salad by itself. I asked for the check after we were done and the check included the salad so we told them we never received it. They told us that it was JUST done being prepared - what? how can a salad take longer than 3 pizzas to be prepared?? We said we just wanted it off of our tab because we were done with our meal. They just gave us the salad anyway (star for that) we had to wait a long time for the fixed check, to go box, etc. We wanted to empty the table for them since it was a full house but man they are REALLY slow...

I am a sucker for CPK and would frequent the San Mateo location in the Bay Area often.  I loved that location because each server was great.  My rating reflects the lack of and rude service at THIS location because honestly I love the food but try your luck at the Brentwood one because the servers here probably could care less about you.  Came here with a party of 7. We could not get a hold of our server because he would disappear and just gave a very rude attitude when asked to bring things or ordering.   The food is worth 4 stars to me for the price.  But the service brings it down 2 stars and I doubt I will come to this location again.  The only reason I would is because its so close to UCLA.

I love the spinach artichoke dip here -- $10. The jambalaya was aitee ($15.50). The chicken alfredo here is pretty good though.  Service is okay. The prices were meh, could be a dollar lower and I'd be okay with it. One plus though were the free refills. Between the two of us, we ordered one mango italian soda ($3). Our server was cool about letting us try other flavors (peach, kiwi). We were only charged for one drink on our bill, *thumbs up.*

I understand it gets busy during lunch, solution? Hire more people!!  First of all, a lot of the people who come here during lunch are UCLA employees (me included) we only get an hour lunch, so it's pretty important that we get in and out quickly.  It's almost impossible to get out of there fast enough. When we go, we always have to make sure we get there at 11:30 to avoid the wave of nooners that come in.  The food? Ehh, alright. It's really nothing spectacular, but I must commend them on freshness and the overall cleanliness of the restaurant and restrooms. The staff is usually very friendly also.

I'm really sad that CPK no longer carries the portabello mushroom ravioli!  The menu is hardly recognizable! As far as this location, it gets really busy during lunch and dinner hours so make sure to make a reservation or you will be waiting of upwards of 45 minutes.  There is a nice outdoor patio and nice indoor bar that you can choose from.
as always I hate CPK on principle. my pasta was ok, nothing special.

Probably the best California Pizza Kitchen I've been to. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich for lunch and it was really good!  We sat outside and it was really nice, didn't see the inside but for lunch outside on a nice LA day it was prime!  The staff was really friendly and our waitress was great! Definitely will return.
Good consistent food.  Great for lunch.  If you're rolling solo, you can sit at the bar and get awsome service.

I got to the door at 9:29pm The door was already locked. I called and was told that the kitchen closes at 9pm. Spoke to the manager who made it clear that if I want to take home food from CPK in Westwood then I need to get there 5min before his watch shows 9:30pm. He then said that nobody told me that the kitchen closes at 900pm as the kitchen closes when he locks the door. He then said he understands that I am a little upset. I guess I will take my business elsewhere. Their salads are overpriced anyway.

This is the smallest CPK I have ever been to. I came this particular night to help support a fundraiser event for a great cause. But never mind about that, let's talk about the food.  On this particular night they had a 3 course dinner with one appetizer, two entrées, and a dessert. My partner and I decided on the spinach artichoke dip, garlic fettuccine alfredo, the original bbq chicken pizza (on there new had tossed dough, and finishing it off with a butter cake.  The dp was really good, but I wish they would use better chips, which to me, were a bit stale. The pasta was good, but they alfredo was just a tad too clumpy for my taste. The flavors on the pizza was good, but I really couldn't find any difference between the old dough and the new "hand toss" dough. Finally the dessert.  Originally I was going to get the key lime pie. I'm a suckered for a good key lime, but our server suggested that we get the butter cake instead. At this point the hostess chimed in and said it was the best thing the served. Our interest was peaked, so we ordered it. This was the saving grace of the evening. Before the dessert came out I'd ordered a glass of resling and it just wasn't right the would night. It tasted like a dry chardonnay, which I don't like. The resling I ordered was a favorite of mine, but it didn't taste right, even when they opened a new bottle for me. So the fact that the butter cake was so awesome, I forgive the bad wine.  Overall, service was great, food was good, wine was bad,  and the & dessert is worth coming back for.

Go to place when I wanna eat out buy not sure what I want. The pizza never dissapoints obviously. Gotta get the think crust BBQ. Always caught In between that and the chicken tequilla pasta. Most of the time get both or have my girl get and I get the other lol. N you know you gotta get the spinach dip. Its a must. Love this place. Glad it exists
The staff is so nice and welcoming. The food is great and the new renovation makes the place feel fresh and bright.

We went there with a large party and they sat us right away, service was very good. I wish they would put up calorie counts at this chain though, I've been to ones at other cities and let's just say I had to change my order, it was pretty shocking what some of them were.  But I guess I am giving it 4 stars because I was in somewhat in denial of how many calories I was eating that night.

Despite the recent menu changes from CPK, including changing the pepperoni pizzza (and making it worse), CPK has done some good recently. Their new bread and olive oil is fantastic. Their appetizers and small treats such as the chicken tinga quesadiila and the sesame ginger chicken dumplings are fantastic. sitting at the bar is nice and gives a great view of their flat screen tv. The bartenders and everyone that works there are also very nice and willing to accommodate any customer's needs. For the main course, try the cedar plank salmon! its delicious and comes with some spicy corn on the side that has some feta cheese sprinkled on top. its great!

This location is awesome! I had the best experience here! I went to dinner with a friend tonight and we decided to sit at the bar so we wouldn't have to wait for a table. The bartender was super nice and had some awesome suggestions for us. The manager was super sweet, I believe her name is Nicole! She checked on us multiple times. Our food took a while but we weren't really bothered by it but the manager was so nice that she gave us a complimentary dessert anyways! It was the butter cake with caramel topping and it was so awesome! For dinner we had the usual lettuce wraps and chipotle chicken pizza. Always hits the spot! I would definitely come to this CPK again! You cant beat great service!

Standard CPK meal. Actually decent pizzas, I actually like the think crust artichoke one a lot. Average service. It's a nice and big space with outdoor seating for the warmer days. Nothing extra to rave about and nothing to complain about.
I love CPK.  The are great with their service and work hard to make you what you like.  It is a fun place to go alone or with a group. If you need some where fun to dine---check them out.

Called three times confirming our large group and they said they could accommodate. We show up and they have zero availability for us. Manager also gave attitude. Our bill would have been enormous. I hope their corporate office reads these.

I love CPK.  I've eaten at locations throughout the country.  However, this CKP has the worst service of any CPK I've ever been to. I'd give the food (when served warm) five stars.  However, the service at this location is pretty pitiful.  It usually takes forever to get an order in, the food is usually served cold, and forget about getting any refills on drinks.

Best customer service & wait staff in Westwood.  Very good food!  The halibut was primo!  Big portion, enough for two meals.  Happy hour is a great deal.  Managers at this location are involved and appreciate their customers!  You will feel comfortable here even if you're dining alone.

I tried the sunny side up pizza with bacon. This pizza was delicious! The bolognese pasta was ok, it was a little bland but better than too salty. But I have to say the pizza was delicious and our server was great. Definitely recommend the sunny side pizza with bacon but not the pasta

I came in today and was greeted with great customer service and a welcoming atmosphere. They exhibited great interest in my thoughts about the food and gave me great suggestions on what I should get. My servers name was Daniel and would suggest him to anyone who is looking for a very attentive waiter. I thought that he could have been the manager the way that he carried himself. I will for sure be returning to get the original BBQ salad again.

I find myself at this location often and the food and service is always great. The cuisine here is more innovative than authentic, but they do the classics very well so i really don't see a problem in either regard. More often than not, the door is opened for me upon approach and a pleasant dining experience always ensues.  I've been a fan of CPK for many years and have thoroughly bounced around the menu, which has much for everyone. I personally am a HUGE fan of the "Sicilian" pizza which I pair with an ice cold Guinness. When in mood for pasta, I order the "Fettuccine with Garlic Cream Sauce" with chicken and sauteed mushrooms (you can also order this with shrimp). For $1 you can order a side of  delicious, hot, watch-the-butter-as-it-melts, pita bread (which is what I do alternatively to having the house bread brought out).  I'm here on a weekly basis and am genuinely surprised at some of these reviews. Even the rare, more inexperienced waiters here stay busy, make small talk and smile. What more can you ask for when casually dining? I also don't  understand how you could slam an Italian-style restaurant with a 1 star rant-of-a-review because of the "Chinese Chicken Salad," which isn't even half bad. And yes, it's busy during peak lunch hour and if you get there late enough you're obviously going to have to wait.
From the moment we walked in the door we felt welcome! The food was fresh and th service was impeccable.

Came in before while I was still going to UCLA and had a nice experience. After coming back for an anniversary dinner with my boyfriend to celebrate where we had our first date we had a horrible experience. I feel like CPK is going down hill.  We came in during dinner service, which we were sited in the very back. Hostess smiled and sat us down but felt like we were hauled like cattle. The waiter greeted us and asked if were ready - typical start of to any dine in restaurant. My boyfriend asked for any suggestions, the waiter responded by pointing at the menu and said "here" throwing the menu back at him.  We could tell he wanted to take our order and leave. Did not feel welcomed at all.  Food was ok, sad that the miso salad I normally ordered was no longer on the menu. The cobb salad my boyfriend ordered was not appealing at all. It was not tossed and it looked like it was just thrown on the plate - gross. I mean, salad is the easiest to prepare. It doesn't take that long to make it look good. The waiter never came back only til after we finished everything and 15 min and more waiting for him. We were completely ignored the entire time.  Normally I tip well because I also work in the food industry, so I know how hard it is to deal with customers and handling/juggling everything. But this is the first time I had to not tip! I will no longer be coming to this CPK. Sad.  Note: We also overheard that the waiter couldn't wait to quit since he already had a job interview and was waiting for a call back. Most likely affected his service to us since it showed he no longer cared. Hopefully he gets his act together if he still is with CPK. If not I wish him the best of luck on his new ventures.

I think CPK is a great restaurant chain.  The staff is always friendly and accommodating.   UPDATE:  I am so jazzed that CPK now offers lunch specials where you can choose a smaller version of pizza with a secondary choice of salad, soup, appetizer or other offerings. I absolutely love their non-alcoholic sparkling cranberry cooler, which is only about 50 calories!   The restaurant's newest feature is that if you eat at the counter:  You be able to watch the various chef's create a hand crafted pizza.
Hadn't been here in a while. It was very busy, and the servers weren't the greatest. However the food was great, I got the tostada pizza and it is was delicious. I just wish the service was better.

We were seated quickly, had a very good service as well. Their potato soup is absolutely delicious! We sat here on our laptops for couple of hours and they kept refilling our coffees (win) Definitely would go back.

I hope whoever you take here is patient and interesting because this CPK is super slow! This CPK location has the same good ol' CPK menu. It is small and often busy but it's always slow. It always takes a long time to get seated, get the menu, order, get your food, get the check, and get a box to go.  And c'mon it's Westwood Village, not the mall or the airport. Why not try something new and help the local businesses? It'll sure save you some time and money. ZzzZZzzzZZzzZzZ

Wonderful experience, came here earlier tonight for my Dad's birthday and everything turned out amazing, the food, service, you name it! Only comment I would have to say is that I ordered a side of bacon with my pizza which turned out to be kind of salty but other than that everything was just simply amazing, would like to give a shout-out and thank our waitress who helped make the birthday dinner special: Clare, will be coming back for sure sometime in the near future!

I always have a hard time deciding between my two favorite pizzas - Carne Asada & Tostada (no chicken) they are both so good! I think most people go for their famous bbq chicken pizza.  All their salads are delicious, which ever you may choose I am sure you will be happy! This CPK can get pretty busy for lunch and dinner, so if you are going for lunch here during the week make sure that you get here before 11:30 if you don't want to wait 20-30 min.

Not what it used to be. This used to be one of my absolute favorites. CPK was always so incredibly good, I couldn't believe it was a chain. Now not only is the service always iffy (last five times in a row - literally last five times - got order wrong), but there's a weird bleachy smell on the tables and at the bar. Very unappetizing.

nearest california pizza kitchen to ucla...quick dinner after long sessions...particular location smaller diner atmosphere...crowded weekdays, but short waits for tables...cramp seating and narrow walking space...noisy and hectic...taking a meat pizza, and others having pastas and salads...at a glance, noticing some differences in the appearance from identical menu items from a recent visit at another cpk location not too long ago...salads looking sloppy and poor...food little saltier?...was not the same consistency as other cpk locations...

First CPK experience.....was amazing. Server was very nice and attentive. He alone earned this place the 5 stars. We had "the works" pizza it was also amazing and washed it down with a couple of blue moons. Couldnt ask for more.

GREAT if you want something out of the normal, everyday pizza (and everything else). I am fond of their Kung Pao spaghetti, it's like eating stir fry noodles, but it's not- it's spaghetti. Spaghetti w/o the traditional marinara sauce. It's good... REALLY good... You'll forget about the urge of eating rice with this Kung Pao dish since the noodles do quite well. It's filling too, maybe because the bread & butter keeps coming. Pizzas- BBQ Chicken, Thai Chicken, Greek, and Sicilian- I'd recommend these and cease to disappoint me.

I'm Chinese, but my stomach craves pizza. lol I'm one of the biggest fans of their BBQ chicken pizza. I'm a creature of habit  (and boring) get this pizza 95% of the time. I like their appetizers, like the lettuce wraps and Cabo crab cakes. Most of the time, I don't have room for dessert. p.s. again, you can get two free hours of parking if you know the right garage to park in.

I can't say much about the service, but CPK is an okay place for a bite to eat. It reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory, except CPK isn't as nice and the service is a total downgrade.  Regardless, I can't help but devour their baby clam linguini (white sauce is tons yummier than red sauce) and their signature bbq chicken salad. I actually dislike the whole bbq chicken aspect of it -- everything except it is awesome. That dressing can't be good for you but damn. That salad is amazing. Their foccacio bread thing is delicious as well.

Laid back place to grab a quick bite. Nothing overly impressive. For me this chain always lacks kick in its dishes. I (a total salt and spice fiend) would recommend having them spice things up a bit when you order. That said, my friends do seem to enjoy what they have.  One has a complete addiction to their Kung Pao Spaghetti and another goes in for one of the specialty pizzas and raves about it. Service wasn't up to par on my last visit, although in the past it's been decent.

At 3:30pm this place had 6 tables taken and 2 waiters. And it took 5 minutes to seat us. They tell us to sit anywhere and we do but we didnt get menus. Another 5 minutes go by as we watch the waiter/waitress charge the bills for the tables that are ready to pay. We get the menus and are ready to order but our waitress is running around making drinks and charging more tables. Looking around you can see that the other tables are waiting for one thing or another. Service is real slow here. The food was good though!

Not sure why I always end up here during work, but it is easy, I usually go for the CPK Cobb and it is a safe favorite. Today I went for the Baja tacos and they were actually good fish tacos. Fast, friendly and convenient.

Food is nice, Service is kinda on the slow side, decor is great. You got Tv's and pizza. What more can you ask for?I ordered a Caesar Salad and spaghetti marinara. Caesar salad was same as usually, which I do like. Creamy sauce and the beautiful salad... just staring at it for 10 minutes was torture... then I couldn't stand it and stuffed  it in 5 minutes. Next came the pasta. When I tried it, it was a new taste (I liked it!!). Servie was kinda slow but the wait was manageable. Deserves a 4/5.

The only thing worse than the service was the manager Rubin, who would not even leave his office to speak with us so we finally walked out. Went down the street to Barney's Beanery, and had a blast. Too many good places to put up with that kind of bad service and average food.

Sadly, I can't say I really liked the food.  I had the veggie sandwich with garlic focaccia bread; the sandwich was loaded down with mostly greens and the mushrooms were all pushed to one side of the sandwich.  It was nothing compared to the portabello sandwich down the street at Damon and Pythas (which is cheaper, even).  The split pea and barley soup was alright, though. My boyfriend had the Greek pizza, which he'd give the restaurant 3 stars for.  Despite the small size of the pizzas, you're probably best off going with one of those.  They are the namesake of the restaurant, after all.

Always have a great time/experience here...service is friendly, food is good...lots of calories but oh well, sometimes its ok...always get the artichoke dip as an app, either get a pizza or the roasted vegetable salad as an entree, depending on how healthy I wanna be that day...hosts are pretty nice too

Three stars One for the company I went here with my beautiful partner in crime and we met a professor from UCLA who was drinking  and eating alone at the bar, that explains the two stars and the third star is for being grateful that there was a decent eatery after experiencing BJ's packed up the street. Why I haven't rated this place higher when it gave us safe haven? Well the drinks were horrid we observed two bartenders skimp on the alcohol on many occasions, I know we are going through a recession but bars should be safe as they contribute to the peoples thirst when they celebrate another they have a job or surviving another day in these hard times of ours.

This place is overpriced and yet so many fond memories lie here.  All the times hanging out with friends and having a good time. The experience of gourmet pizza is just a must try once in your life, and CPK is a good place to try that out.  Otherwise you'd have to go to Spago which is way more expensive.

The service has always been great for both in the restaurant and to-go. Sometimes there is a wait but the hostess tries to seat you as quickly as possible. The food has always been good and I love that it is so close to where I live.  My favorite items are the thai chicken pizza, the thai crunch salad, and the tortilla soup.

My friend and I decided to see Magic Mike tonight so we stopped in to eat at CPK. We were seated very fast in a booth seat. And our waiter was nice but very awkward. This wasn't the problem though.... I went to get up and go to the bathroom and asked one of the ladies working there where the bathroom was. Very quietly without even a whisper replies "the right over there" without any direction to where "there" was. So I asked again to clarify that it was back against the back wall of the restaurant and in a very distraught way she says, "yes ma'am".  1. Dont call me "ma'am". I'm 18 yrs old. 2. Speak up so I can hear you 3. Dont give me attitude I'm a paying customer Im only asking where the bathroom is.... So I sit down with my friend and tell her about what happened and we were just kind of like wow wtf... So then the lady walks by and I flag her down because I needed some more water I was very thirsty. So I ask and say, "Excuse me ma'am can I have some more water?"  Well the look she gave me was absolutely rude and disgusting. Not only that my water never came she purposely walked by with the water pitcher and it was full and never attempted to look at me or poor water into my glass. Its like after I called her ma'am she suddenly too became offended  but actually made sure I saw that, but the difference was she was like 30 something and I'm 18 you call me "miss" and I call you "ma'am". So we waited and waited and it became like a joke cause she never came with the water so I asked some waiter guy for water and it was there right away.  They werent busy. She wasn't busy. This was absolutely uncalled for and someone needs to talk to that hostess lady.... Seriously. Until then your not going to get my business or my friends business at your store.

I really enjoy the food and the dining experience at CPK, but especially at the Westwood CPK location.  My daughter and I both love the asparagus soup. She loves it because it is so tasty, I also love it because it taste so good but what is even more important to me is how healthy and low in calories it is.  My daughter also loves the kids curly Mac and cheese. Which after she eats the healthy soup she only eats half of. The kids portions are always big enough that we take half home for the next day. They have great salads also. The staff is always so kind and accommodating. They give out kids menus and crayons as soon as they seat you at your table, which my daughter and her friends really love. It never takes too long to get your food served to you and they bring you your drinks right away. It is true that sometimes there is a short wait during the lunch rush or at dinner time, but what good restaurant doesn't have any wait during those times.
the food is ok but their service is just tooooooooooo slow specially if you are going for your lunch break!

I suppose I'm an 'outside-the-box' kinda guy, but I actually don't order the pizza at CPK.  Crazy? Perhaps.  I'm here to tell you that their jambalaya is the BEST thing on the menu.   I used to love their tortilla soup, but now it's "Sedona White Corn Tortilla Soup", whatever the fuck that is.  All I know is I miss the old recipe.  They also used to have this Brazilian chicken pizza that I loved, but it's gone too. All I know is they better not get rid of my jambalaya, dammit!  Love that jambalaya.

I could've understood the appeal of CPK six or seven years ago, when New American Cuisine and fusion were still in vogue in the culinary world. But now? The popularity of this franchise is flabbergasting. They'll throw anything and everything on a pizza, and hope it works; it's kind of like writing a script on index cards, throwing them in the air, and determining the structure based on which ones you pick up first. I don't want carne asada on a pizza. I don't want guacamole and sour cream on a pizza. I don't want peanuts on a pizza. I don't want potatoes on a pizza. I don't want mangos on pizza. What's worse is that CPK wants you to think that, to quote Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction, you're getting the "gourmet shit." No, you're not. Getting a burrito on a pizza is just a bad idea, and it should be stopped. They don't offer much else - paninis, ceasar salad, "thai chicken peanut pasta," etc, etc, etc.

First of all, the restaurant smells-- and I'm not talking about the good kind of smell.  It was a mixture of rotting food trying to be preserved via refrigeration and wet rag.  yuck. I went with three other coworkers and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, even though they said the wait was 5 minutes.  We were on a time crunch so that wasn't a good start.   Two of us got salads.  It was like eating chopped up lettuce with a cold.  It tasted like nothing, even though it was drenched in fatty dressing.  What a waste of fat/calories!  The only reason I give this place ANY stars is because it had decent appetizers. The waitress kept dropping our bread on the table and when she brought us our pita bread for our hummus appetizer, she dropped those too!  She didn't even apologize or get us new bread/pita bread.  The only thing she said was a cheery "oops!" as she dropped our food onto the wet rag wiped table!!! I don't know how this place is still in business.  Service is definitely mediocre, and the food is definitely sub par.  Their pizza is just OKAY and there are definitely better places to get pizza in Westwood!   So then, you're probably wondering why I keep going back.  Trust me... it's NOT by choice.  I just don't want to be rude and insult the restaurant in front of the people who go there because they haven't had the chance to experience something better.   There are plenty of restaurants that serve tastier food (and not to mention cheaper!) than CPK.  I'm all about good food at good prices... and this place offers neither.

There is always a wait at this location but the food is good!  The egg roll appetizers are tasty (with dipping sauce) and I recommend the waldorf chicken salad with the balsamic dressing.  Mmmm, tasty! Their lemonade is also very good. It's a chain. What can I say? They are all about the same.

I love the specialty pizzas at this place. I realize CPK is a chain, but where I am from we simply don't have them. So when I moved to LA I became an instant fan of the Greek Pizza and the Chicken Tandoori Pizza. The various assortment of lemonades also make the place a worthwhile venture. The appetizers are also excellent especially the spinach dip and the Sonora egg rolls. I always order those egg rolls. The prices are the main drawback...but I am also a cheapskate so what do I know. Not a place I'd go everyday but nice to visit once in a while.

Generic specialty pizzas but still fresh made with fresh ingredients and willing to make substitutions. Pizza is basically terrible unless you tell them to make it thin. The tomato based sauces are bad. The best pizza at this chain is the salad pizza w or w/out salad.

Not one of the better CPK's around. Have been here a few times, and the food is hit or miss. Got a pretty tasteless mushroom pizza once, where the cheese was runny and didn't seem to want to stick to the pizza dough too much. Had a HILARIOUS waiter though. I would go back just to be served by that guy again. Our meal cost $34 and some change. I paid with a $100 bill, and he gave us back $65 in 5 dollar bills. Random. The food, though? Ehh.

Westwood was my home for 2 months while my husband is in and out of ucla hospital..I can always count on a clean setting and wonderful service here.   There could not be a nicer bunch of people, more dependable food, great service.      And try the panzanella (sp?) salad... sooooo good.

This place always kills me for its sheer absence of college students, despite its location smack dab in the middle of Westwood.  The food's decent, nothing to get worked up about, but good, and the place always seems to be really clean.  The reason I (and most other college students, I think) rarely go to CPK is that it's way overpriced for the tiny flat-crust pizzas you get.  I guess it's enough to fill up those of lesser appetites, but it's a bit of a joke in my case.  I don't think CPK really cares about those criticisms, though, and maybe they shouldn't, since every time I go by the place it's packed to capacity with highschoolers and old people.

I have been to the Westwood CPK twice, and both times I was kindly greeted by the general manager, whom I believe is named Matthew.  Upon placing my order, despite being quite busy, my food arrived very promptly and I was asked by many employees how the food was.  I have been VERY impressed by the service and the management of Westwood CPK.

I ordered a shrimp scampi pizza to-go from here. It came loaded with about 15 pieces of shrimp which is a good price for... I think $13 or so. It was good. That's about all I can say about this place because I haven't dined in here. I've been to other CPKs but I'm not really a fan of pizzas.

I was going here at least once a week near the end of last quarter, mostly due to the amount of 20% off coupons my roommates managed to hoard.  And we never got too sick of this place, which attests to its greatness. The BLT pizza never disappoints, and I recommend you try it, as it's not very popular but delicious.  Haven't had too much trouble with the wait, but that's probably because we go around 6 or 7 and on weeknights. The waiters are moderately nice, sometimes they're impatient beautiful people who get a little annoyed when we ask for 5 of their "don't open it" cards... each. (That was a promotion they had in May and June where we ended up with all the coupons). I wish their drinks were cheaper, as the only time I was there with my fake I.D. I felt that I was spending enough on the food so I passed.  And psst, here's a secret: Thai Crunch Salad, Thai Spring Rolls, Thai Pizza, Thai Linguine-- all have pretty much the same ingredients. And all ROCK. Cheese alert: Some say variety is the spice of life, but I say spice is the spice of life.  So yeah I could eat this every day. If I could afford it.

CPK is pretty awesome. I had the Wild Mushroom Pizza with the chicken, it was pretty good. Also very filling. I don't think this specific branch is any different than other CPK's except for the fact that it can get pretty busy here. Be prepared to wait at least 15 minutes. All in all the food was good and we left satisfied.

California pizza kitchen is a safe place for decent food and good service. The food is a little pricey in my opinion for the quality/taste. There are some dishes however that I think and more worth it than others. The tostada pizza is pretty unique and tasty. Also, the apple crisp dessert is nice. The crisp part on top is delicious...the apple stuff on bottom, not so much. But that may be just cus I'm not a huge apple sauce/syrup kind of guy. Their salads are plentiful- so know the portion sizes are good. LIke the 3-stars says; this place is A-ok. Its a safe choice for lunch or dinner.

I'll give this place 2 stars for the pleasant and timely service i usually receive here, and for the decent salads.  Okay, i suppose this is the LA answer to pizza, a hybrid of different tastes on a pizza crust, with or without the traditional cheese & tomato sauce.  Maybe that's why for years i've always been dragged to this place, a mere stones throw from the respectable D'Amores and Lamonica's.  I can't help but be reminded of my childhood, when my friends and i would take out the old boboli bread crust and fill it with whatever was in the fridge (usually asian food btw).  Hey, i'm definitely not a traditionalist- i like pizzas from italy to chicago and many places in between.  I only ask that they taste good.   And therein lies the problem- the thai bbq pizza is bad satay with canned peanut sauce on boboli.  the jamican jerk chicken is so mild it probably wouldn't even be recognized as such by someone from the island.  the carne asada pizza is not near taco-truck quality in preparation.  Geez, couldn't you make something more edible with fire roasted tomatillios, marinated meat and mexican cheese or something?  one edible pizza- the blt, which is basically a blt on pizza dough- can't go wrong with thick applewood bacon.  i'm sure i made one of these for myself in grade school...

Another chain restaurant that suffers in service because of some pre-conceived issues with working in a college neighborhood. I have been to other CPKs and they are usually pretty attentive, refilling water and drinks every 20 minutes or so, offering bread, etc. But the one in Westwood, all the servers appears to be terminally cranky. I ordered the Waldorf salad and proceeded to wait for my bread which didn't come... I asked for some bread after 30 minutes and they said that CPK had a newpolicy to only serve bread when asked? I went to a CPK back at home after this and they served us bread, so I don't know what policy are they talking about. So they brought out the bread, nothing special, just a nice sliced sourdough. My salad comes out and its good. I like combination of the tartness of the grapes, the sweetness of the glazed walnuts, the salty grilled chicken, the crunchiness of the apples and the bite of the blue cheese. Its one of the things I always get at CPK. I ordered a mango lemonade, and they only refilled it once after much prodding. I finally got irritated and got a to-go cup and brought my lemonade with me. So 3 stars for again giving my blue in a well-executed dish. -2 stars for questionable service.

Horrific. As I'm seeing others have had similar experiences, I've come to the conclusion that this CPK. is. crap. As college students (which I'm guessing 80%+ of their guests are), my boyfriend and I weren't looking to spend $50 at a casual dining restaurant. Thus, he ordered a ravioli dish (which he calculated as costing 75 cents per ravioli...wtf?) and I a $9 cobb salad and a peach iced tea. As soon as we placed this initial order, the waiter had decided that we were on the bottom of his pyramid of patrons worthy of adequate service, and made sure we knew it. Service throughout the night was sluggish, rude, and otherwise non-existent. Being CPK newbies, we weren't even aware that complimentary bread was served until we noticed everyone around us got it [so contrary to others who got the generic "we're out" excuse, they DID have bread, we just weren't important enough?].  Fed up, I decided mid-meal to either ask the manager for a complaint form or look for some kind of "HOW'S OUR SERVICE? CALL 800-CPK-LOVE" number to let them have a piece of my mind. After being thrown a final quizzical look by the server when asking for a refill for my iced tea [which had been empty for a good 15 mins.] and our check, I found a link to a satisfaction survey. Oh, I filled it out, though not expecting anything to happen. ...the next day! I get a call from Nicole[?], the branch manager. After heartily apologizing and explaining that that's "not what we're about", she asked for my address so she could send me some coupons to use at the branch of my choice. She said she'd send it out that day. ...3 days later, nothing. Not that I'm planning on returning to ANY cpk (rude server is one thing, but a dishonest Branch Manager is on a completely different level of unprofessional conduct).  All in all, the food was pretty standard, by taste alone. Combined with the quality of service and the price, I'd say it's not worth it. My advice? Wait the 15-20 mins. [or make a reservation] and go to BJ's up the street.

I was elementally opposed to dining at this restaurant. My little Trojan heart was uneasy in enemy territory. But the hunger was much and time was ticking so I gave my name to the server and waited 20 minutes for a table. Our food took FOREVER to come-- more than 25 minutes easy. The server forgot about us after the food came, although we got a few refills, we waited about 20 minutes for our check with no server in sight. Terrible service! I'll go back to Trojan territory next time- the CPK by USC is actually pretty awesome!

Generally nice staff. Fast service but they don't clear empty cups or plates very quickly. Asked for avocado on my salad per the waiter's suggestion but they didn't add it. I've had better cpk experiences but not terrible here.

Oh, CPK.  I can't even begin to count the number of times I've been here.  I've been coming here since high school, and it's always been great.  The service is excellent, even on very busy days.  There's always someone coming up to refill your water.  The wait staff are a very good-looking and professional bunch of people.   The food is excellent.  I usually order the pizza, but sometimes I opt for something different.  I really like their salads.  My favorite is the Thai chicken salad.  The great thing about CPK is that you can get a half plate and consume less calories than you normally would getting a full plate.  Their portions are enormous so it's a good thing that you get a half-plate option.   Their soup is also great - I've ordered their tortilla soup, which was rich and filling.  And of course you can't go wrong with their pizza!  They have a lot of random assortments of pizzas.  You can get a classic pizza (cheese or sausage) or you can try a chipotle chicken pizza (with a fantastic spicy chipotle chicken sauce), or an assortment of Asian-style pizzas with excellent sauces. The only pizza I woult not recommend getting is the goat cheese pizza... I am not a big fan of goat cheese, so it's not really the best thing to get, but it's really a matter of personal choice. I also highly recommend their appetizers!  Their spinach appetizer dip is really fantastic and you can share it with a group of people.  They have other dipping appetizers as well. I come here at least a few times a year, and i've been to several locations (Westwood, Santa Monica, Marina Del Rey, Encino), and I have not yet been disappointed with their service or their food.

Much improved service and menu selections since there remodel of the restaurant. Atmosphere is very inviting with an open air and modern feeling and nice high tables. Food was very good and our server was quick and on top of everything. Even had a manger that was visible walking around making sure things ran smoothly, which they did. Overall experience was very, very good.
solid cpk. Not a great location in terms of parking and service. Usually crowded and apathetic servers. Saving grace...the pizza of course.
Ok, it's CPK. But I have to write a review because I just tried their BBQ Hawaiian Pizza and Butter cake w/ice cream and OMG! Both soooo good. You gotta try it!!

Thank you management. I am giving a five star rating even though my food was delivered burnt. Here's why: the manager was apologetic, sympathetic and completely refunded me. The customer service was A+++. Thank you.

Yay for the most overrated chain of pizza places ever!!!!! We all know the hype and please don't lie to yourselves, it doesn't live up to it. yea it's pretty good, i guess.... but not at the prices they charge and the lines they have. I would never wait for it, but if you brought it to me, i'd be stoked. sort of. The artichoke dip though, is THAT GOOD, but its like 9 bucks for dip. seriously let me type that again NINE DOLLARS FOR DIP DIP DIP DIP DIP DIP NINE DOLLARS that should seem wrong to you

I got a take out order 1 new pulled pork pizza( habanero carnitas pizza), one BBQ chicken pizza and 1 Bbq chicken salad. The meat on the pulled pork pizza was so overcooked and dry. Leather-like, unedible. The BBQ chicken pizza tasted like a frozen grocery store pizza, undercooked and plastic tasting.  This is so disappointing. At $16 for the salad, it was ok, but $16!!!??  Pizzas were $13 each. This will keep me from going back to any CPK. Shame they've become so commercialized.  Frozen manufactured, prefixed meals....sad....

Pizza is good here at this location. Price is nice if you go with friends. Not a good beer selection but not a big deal too my. If you like loud busy place then it has lots of people. I am fan of the spaghetti dish and salad is fresh.

The first time I had CPK was at this place, when I moved to LA for school, and I really liked it since we didn't really have a place like this in the Bay Area. The first thing I tried was the BBQ chicken pizza. It was really thin , but really filling for me as I don't eat that much pizza anyways , but I really liked it ,my friends and I usually share one . Nowadays I usually get the club sandwich and I love it. It's just the right portions and the bread is so good and the salad on the side makes me feel a little better about eating so much. haha great vibe though and it's usually not crowded enough where you have to wait forever long.

I have been to this CPK a few times, and the experience has been consistently mediocre every time I have gone. I went today to have a birthday lunch for a coworker and they were easily able to accommodate a group of nine since I called ahead (they don't take official reservations, but they will write your name down on the list if you call just before going). However, the service always seems to be lacking at this CPK, and pretty much every CPK I have ever been to. CPKs in general seem like they overwhelm their wait staff with too many tables because they are always difficult to find or flag down. The food at this CPK tastes the same as every other CPK. My favorite thing on the menu is the Thai Chicken Pizza, and my least favorite is the tortilla soup. I typically love tortilla soup, but the soup at CPK almost always gives me a horrible stomach ache so I avoid getting it.  If there is something that I would say that CPK does well it would be that they are consistent in all that they do. Their food is pretty good and tastes exactly the same regardless of which CPK you go to, and the service is consistently below average.  This CPK is no different than any other CPK I have been to, besides being a bit smaller.  If you are craving pizza in the Westwood area there are much better options, and the service here is just not up to par.

i love coming here for their bbq chicken pizza. most places use too much bbq sauce and their chicken is dry, but this pizza combo turns out pretty well from cpk. i also like that everyone can order their own individual sized pizza and it doesn't come out as a huge 16" that must be shared between a few people. this way, i get to take my bbq chicken pizza home in a cute cpk take-out pizza box and have leftovers for the next day (or two!). i came here once with a party of 20 people. we were seated outside at a long table in the alleyway next to the restaurant, but i think they kept forgetting we were there because we didn't have a server check in on us for long periods of time, which meant food took forever to come out. so don't come with too large of a group or else there isn't a table large enough to seat everyone together inside the restaurant.  the service here is just ok. i think because this location caters to a lot of students, so naturally the service becomes a little lackluster because less is expected of both the restaurant staff and the customers who come here. there's a cpk in brentwood that's run much better and the pizza is just as good.
I love CPK.  Especially for lunch.  I normally have the BBQ chicken salad.  This time I had a sandwich.  It was just ok nothing special.  The soups are also great!

I'm okay with CPK. I came here a couple of times for some special occasions. One time, I shared the artichoke dip appetizer and BBQ chicken pizza with the BF. Both were good, though nothing to rave about. I think this is a good place to have lunch or dinner with friends, because they can cater to a large group, and the service here is okay. However, I'm not a big fan of CPK, though I will give them props because the CPK's I've been to are consistent in terms of how their food tastes. I really like their Thai chicken pizza, but CPK is not my first choice when I'm craving some pizza.

Came here expecting a nice lunch with my family. Instead they had horrible service. It took them 15 minutes to sit us down at a dirty table, even though most of the tables were in fact empty. The carpets were filthy and full of trash as if they hadn't cleaned or vacuumed in days. After sitting there for another 15 minutes, there was no waiter to be found. We ended up walking out. Not to mention the woman sitting in a booth nearby had a dog.

The CPK is always very welcoming. The service here is great and very friendly. The appetizers arrived very fast and the meals did not take too long after. I ordered the California Club pizza which is pretty good. CPK always has a very unique selection of pizzas that are fairly priced and very different from other pizza restaurants. Although the pizza was good, it probably was not the best that I've ever hard. Overall, CPK is a very nice default place to go to that is affordable and delicious.

CPK always makes me happy.  They have so many options that there is something for everyone, and that makes it a great place to go for group outings.  There is an outside area that is often not too full, and it makes for great people watching. If you are a regular, some of the waiters will learn to know who you are and what you probably want (especially if you are like me and only change your order between two or three things).  I must say, the roasted pepper and goat cheese pizza is probably my favorite thing on the menu.  It is not necessarily enough food to share between two people, but if I order it myself, I do usually take enough home to satisfy me for another meal.     Overall, I would recommend most CPK locations, but if you are a UCLA undergrad, this is a great place to go.  They also have curbside delivery, so if you call in your order, they'll bring it right out to your car when you come to pick it up!  Convenience is great!

Meh. Meh. Meh. First of all, CPK is overpriced for its food. I'll admit, it's a place to go and try out, lots of people come around here for lunches and dinners. But I don't think CPK is anything special. For a food chain, it does a pretty good job in keeping the food consistent. The food is decent, it's not bad at all. But again, it's overpriced. I've only been here for fundraisers for certain organizations at UCLA, but that's the only reason I'd come around. For being a pizza kitchen, it's all right. It has a good set of different flavors together, but I'm not a fan of the thinner crusts and for specializing in supposedly good pizzas, it's not that great. To be honest, I would still prefer to order a large pizza from pizza hut for just 10 bucks.

My daughter, who is a teen, treated me to a post Mothers Day lunch at this CPK.  The manager on duty just happened to take our order.  Once she found out that my daughter was treating, she made our lunch VERY enjoyable and affordable.  I have eaten at this location before and have had a good experience and great service.  Thank you CPK Westwood!

There are pros and cons about reviewing a mainstream chain restaurant. - Con: It's hard to convey how it differs from every other CPK out there. - Pro: When you already have a standard, it's blatantly clear when something is good or bad. I went to this CPK and ordered a BBQ Chicken chopped salad. I received said salad and proceeded to dig in. Once I started eating, I realized that the lettuce towards the bottom of my salad was super cold. No, not just chilled - icy cold. Like, it was still frozen. Like I said, when you have a standard, it's way easier to write your review. 2 stars for a frozen salad.
Very slow service and a mediocre at best sandwich. Our food was comped, but I would never return. It had been five years since my last visit there, and to be quite honest, it has only gotten worse.

I usually get the margarita pizza at CPK. Occasionally I'll get a pasta, but I figured, I'm at a the california PIZZA kitchen, I should probably get a pizza, it's more of their specialty.  This location was nice. Parking was easy, we parked in the structure across the street which was a $3 flat rate. Our waitress was friendly and efficient. Solid dining experience.
Food was okay. Fast and satisfied but not wonderful. Liking the new small plate menu. The pazanella salad was good. Tri color salad pizza also good.

this place ain't bad to go to right before catching a flick since you just have to cross the street. it's really the same as the other cpk's but a tad bit more crowded than the one on sunset. probably the location.

I love CPK.  It is yummy food and always a safe decision.   I tend to order the same things but try to branch out.  We went here last week for dinner.  It was after 9pm and I was exhausted and beyond starving.  As I looked through the menu, I debated on what to get as usual.  At the bottom of the menu I noticed that they want you to experiment and try something new and if you don't like it, they will take it away and bring you whatever you want!  I thought this was pretty neat.  Yes, I said it....neat.    So, I decided to be daring and decided to try the new Pear & Gorgonzola pizza.......YUMMY!   I recommend.  A lot of different flavors that all mix together nicely.  So the food itself gets 4-5 stars but the service kills it.  Our waiter was TERRRRIBLE!  We had to keep asking him to refill drinks, he was not attentive in the least bit, and kept forgetting anything we asked for.  He was a nightmare.   I love CPK but will definitely be trying to avoid this location.

CPK usually is what it is, and for the most part, this location is just like any other middle class "neighborhood" chain restaurant. BUT...this location is on the small side and is VERY busy since its located in the prime heart of Westwood Village. I worked on the UCLA campus over the summer, and there is always a crowd outside for dinner every day of the week and the wait often runs over 1.5 hours. Not to mention they don't like taking reservations, which understandably would be meaningless at a place as busy as this one. My biggest gripe is that the restaurant seems perpetually understaffed, and the quality of the food is definitely subpar compared to other CPKs (that's a problem considering how CPK is already overpriced and the food is normally run-of-the-mill). Like AIZIL, there was one time when they ran out of bread. How does a pizza place run out of bread? Our friendly waiter did go to the kitchen and came back with some garlicky flavored pizza crust that I thought was a pretty slick save. But for the half-dozen times that I've been there, this CPK is mediocre. Three stars at best. Want real good pizza? Try Enzos right down the street.

I think this CPK has improved a lot in the past 3 years. I still sometimes have issues with wait staff being slow, not bringing bread, not offering dessert, etc. But the food has seemed to improve a lot making it on par with other CPKs. Before I would have issues with the kung pao spaghetti being bland or the BBQ chicken pizza not having enough BBQ sauce or the rosemary chicken sandwich being burned but in the past maybe 5-10 times I've been there the food has been excellent - for a CPK. The curbside takeout is one of the trickier things to figure out. You actually go into the parking lot next store to CPK - just tell the attendant you're there for CPK and there are two reserved CPK curbside spaces in the front of the lot.

I've never met a meal I didn't like.  At the very least, I would still eat what I'd order at any restaurant and just choose not to come there again.  For the first time in my life, I've actually refused to eat what I ordered. Adobe Chicken Chowder was the culprit.  Know what a "vurp" is?  It's a vomit + burp--where you vomit a little when letting out a burp.  Adobe Chicken Chowder, you taste like a vurp after a hard night of drinking...with a dash of tapatio. CPK, how dare you use the word 'chowder' in the name of this soup.  When my tongue hears the word chowder, it gets excited like a fat kid double-fisting ice cream cones.  Your cousin Clam chowder is ashamed of you.  Clam chowder tastes good.  You should've tasted good.  Ugh.

This review is specific to only the Westwood location.   I've eaten at the CPK in Brentwood (decent), the location at Hollywood & Vine (actually good) and stopped by the CPK to go in Culver to grab a quick bite (horrendous).  I know, I know  - why do I keep going back??  What is wrong with me?  For some reason, I used to be hopeful about CPK and my bf does really like on of their pizzas.  But after last week - NO MORE.  So, in regards to the Westwood location --  I despise this place. The food is inconsistent - mainly bad - and the service is SO BAD it's almost funny.  Almost.   I used to work in the area, and had lunch there 3-4 times - lunch time is not so bad - decent.  I actually liked (past tense) the Meditteranean Salad there.  Stay far far away from the Spinach Artichoke dip, its soupy and super greasy.  Carry out and dinner is just torture.  Granted, I know its Westwood and the place is overtaken by college kids, but the staff just doesn't give a sh*t.  The hostess was not the sharpest tack.   Overall no bueno, save your time and money and walk down the street to Damon & Pythias..

I brought my family here one day for lunch before they headed out to the airport. We ordered 2 pizzas to share. White pizza tasted alright, but it was a little bland for my taste. And a meat pizza- full of flavor. I also got the broccoli sun-dried tomato fusili pasta- it was ok. The food overall was just ok. They served us bread at the table, but it was cold. Our server was really nice and service was on point. I felt the food was a little pricey.

Crowded and relatively expensive, much like every other CPK on the west coast.  I guess the thai chicken pizza has lost its novelty after years of business.  Today, the food definitely tastes cheap.   I don't know if this is regular policy, but if you want dinner bread these days, you have to ask.  And make sure you don't ask for the "dinner rolls"  they cost extra.

Sometimes, you just have a hard day at work, and you say, "you know what?  I really don't want to get some lame sandwich, but I also don't want to go to some bar and get smashed at lunch, but I still want a treat!"  And those are the days I call CPK and ask them to please please please have a white pizza or a BBQ chicken or a Thai chicken ready for me so I can run in and grab it. And I don't care if it costs more than my average lunch.  Because it's better than going to Brewco and getting drunk at lunch and going back to work and saying really inappropriate things to my coworkers.

I generally like CPK but this one isn't anything special besides the location being convenient.  the drinks aren't at all great and a lot of times the pizza doesn't come out warm. the pizza is also a bit expensive. i would recommend a lot of the other good pizza places in westwood like enzos and lamonicas. it's good for groups though.

The Westwood location of CPK gets 4 stars.   I have always liketd the pizza at CPK... even the pastas are tasty and their salads aren't bad either.    Now that I think about it, I even like their appetizers, although they are WAY overpriced whereas most items on the menu are an OK deal.  Don't be ordering a pepperoni or a plain cheese pizza, or God will kill a kitten for no reason. My favorites: Their eggroll type appetizer with the dipping sauce Chinese chicken salad Thai pasta Carne Asada Pizza (probably has the most flavors going on) Sweet and spicy italian sausage pizza BBQ chicken pizza The pizza must be on the HONEY WHEAT DOUGH please. Stay away from the tostada pizza.  Lettuce on a pizza makes me want to kill myself.  And you best believe that before I die, I will take at least 100 kittens with me for no reason. To those of you who gave CPK bad reviews, I respect your opinions and all of that, but I've been here SO many times and I really think those who give CPK a bad rap, just don't "get it".    If it's not your thing, then just leave it be.  But CPK isn't bad food. The only thing I dislike about the westwood location is there is usually a long wait, and the service is not the best, nor is their pizza that consistent.   For these reasons I would say Westwood CPK is not as good as the Beverly Hills location, on south beverly drive. The S. Beverly Drive is the ORIGINAL location for god's sake.  The S. Beverly Drive location is BY FAR the best.  The staff is always on their toes because bitchy Beverly Hills moms are very demanding when it comes to sending back pizzas, getting orders perfected, etc.   Therefore, for a normal customer, they are usually quite competent of taking care of your order.   I also believe the cooks at S. Beverly Drive have been there for a really long time, because they put out consistently (which is the #1 most important factor) the best pizza of any CPK location I've tried.  You can see the experience in their technique.

I was disappointed with this particular CPK. Granted it was a Saturday evening and there were a lot of people, they could have been more organized when it came to assigning seats. When we were finally shoved off to the outdoor table (which was so small that it couldn't even fit 4 people, not to mention our party of 6), we were left forgotten for a good while. The server who eventually came was an extremely impatient young woman. When we're finally done with our orders, she rolled her eyes and uttered "Huh? That's all?" Yes, we only wanted salad and pizzas. We did not want any drinks. I thought it's a pizza place! Didn't she see that on her apron? I actually liked their pizza, but the service? I am not coming back.

I am a fan of CPK and have been for a while seeing as how I grew up on it. Im writing this review because of the service not the food. Infact, we basically got no service. I called at 3 pm for an after lunch rush pickup order. Me and a buddy ordered a sandwich, salad, and two appetizers. Some guy took our order, but seemed either clueless or new to the job. He re-read our order to me, took down my phone number and everything, told us to pick it up at 3:30...so I thought it'd be legit...little did I know! We get there, go to the back where take out orders are...wait 5 min for someone to come and ask us about our order...said she didnt have it in the computer and went to go check on it in the office or something.  10 minutes later she comes back and reconfirms that there is no order....ridiculous. Never ever should a restaurant be so clueless to something like that. She asked if we wanted to wait for it...definitely not.  Walked a block to whole foods and got a sandwich instead. saved 20 bucks tho! thanks for at least that cpk!

this is the best CPK in LOS ANGELES COUNTY. i have been here many many times but never got a chance to review this place.  everything is super delicious. from appetizer to main meal to dessert. everything is well done. service is always outstanding. I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS CPK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've had this buffalo wing craving for the past month or so and haven't been able to kick it.  Yesterday, I also wanted pizza.  Here come CPK to the rescue with buffalo chicken pizza.  It was a perfect combination of the two.  It's definitely a strange combination, but I can't say that my craving was exactly normal.

The only time I've ever been highly appreciative of CPK food was when I was starving at an airport and caught a whiff of some CPK ASAP garlic. When looking for good pizza in Westwood, this is usually one of the last places I turn to.  Food: In the style of Wolfgang Puck, CPK supposedly serves gourmet pizzas along with pastas, salads, and other light entrees. The selection of these pies is broad, but I have to admit that the quality just isn't there. Sometimes I feel as if the same pizza could have been sitting in a freezer box prior to landing on the table. What they lack in quality is not made up in size. The pizzas are small and can leave you hungry. Portions for the pasta entrees are better, but I've never been wowed by anything I've ordered here.  Service: Somewhat slow, but tolerable. I've experienced waits of 15 minutes that turned out to be more like 5. Maybe they do this to appear busier than reality dictates.  Atmosphere: Seating is a bit cramped although the patio is a fun place to enjoy your meal. As is the case with many Westwood restaurants, CPK's outdoor seating borders a road that experiences a fair amount of traffic.
